title: Should Amazon, Microsoft, Google and Other Cloud Companies Face More Government Oversight?
sub_head: Individuals and companies depend on their services. But they are more lightly regulated than other crucial industries. Three experts debate their future.
body:
Cloud-computing services are so ubiquitous that itâ€™s hard to fathom modern life without them.
Take a photo on your phone and it is zapped to a cloud service for storage. Order shoes online, book a hotel room or stream a TV show, and the transaction likely takes place in the cloud. Moreover, thousands of companies and government agencies use cloud computing to run their core internal software and databases.
